page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: The school was all age(5-14).Children had to walk up to 3mls. each way.Wet clothes were dried around the classrooms' coke stoves. Dinners (often pasties) were eaten in houses in the village.Discipline was strict and corporal punishment frequently used.Attendance was good except for busy times in the farming year-hay making,harvesting etc. when many boys were absent.A few farmers sons attended private schools. Childrens games.A rich variety. The most popular were marbles,conkers, whip & tops,hoops and 'fag cards'.Hare and hounds was the favourite outdoors. Courtship.A strong tendency for marriages to take place between couples in the parish -'foreigners' very unwelcome and handled roughly. Bicycles and motor bikes have changed this as young men went further afield.
